Wave plate

Polarized light
$$\vec{E} = \cos(t)\vec{u}_x + \cos(t)\vec{u}_y$$
Shifted light
The animation on the left shows the change of the electric field of light given by $$ \vec{E}=E_{0x}\cos(\omega t)\vec{u}_x + E_{0y}\cos(\omega t + \phi)\vec{u}_y $$ The animation on the right represents the light after going through a waveplate. The resulting vector is obtained by changing the basis vectors of \(\vec{E}\) to the rotated axis, and retarding the component on the slow axis with $$ t_r=t-\sigma $$ The animation was done using Pts.js. The code can be found here.
